simulator.payloads.translators
Class CanPayloadTranslator

java.lang.Object
  simulator.payloads.translators.CanPayloadTranslator
Direct Known Subclasses:
BooleanCanPayloadTranslator, BooleanCanTranslator, DesiredFloorCanPayloadTranslator, DriveCommandCanPayloadTranslator, IntegerCanPayloadTranslator, VarIntegerCanTranslator
public abstract class CanPayloadTranslator
extends java.lang.Object

Utility superclass for CanPayloadTranslators. Descendants of this class know how to encode and decode a specific message type from the binary representation of data used by the CanMailbox object. This class provides constructors for both WriteableCanMailbox objects and ReadableCanMailbox objects so that the same translator can be used with both types of objects. Any translator descended from this class should implement both constructors.

See Also:
BooleanCanPayloadTranslator, IntegerCanPayloadTranslator, DesiredFloorCanPayloadTranslator, DriveCommandCanPayloadTranslator

Constructor Detail

CanPayloadTranslator

public CanPayloadTranslator(CanMailbox.WriteableCanMailbox payload,
                            int byteSize)
Construct a CanPayloadTranslator using the data from the payload object. This constructor does not perform a CAN message ID check, and should only be used for generic contructors (like BooleanCanPayloadTranslator) which can be used for payloads with different IDs.

Parameters:
payload - the WriteableCanMailbox containing the bit-level network data that is read or written by the translator.
byteSize - the byte size of the data that is expected in the payload. This value is read by the payload object, and an error is generated if you try to set bits on the payload that exceed the size specified by byteSize.

CanPayloadTranslator

public CanPayloadTranslator(CanMailbox.WriteableCanMailbox payload,
                            int byteSize,
                            int expectedId)
Construct a CanPayloadTranslator using the data from the payload object. In general, it is safer to use this consructor for CAN translators that deal with specific message values.

Parameters:
payload - the WriteableCanMailbox containing the bit-level network data that is read or written by the translator.
byteSize - the byte size of the data that is expected in the payload. This value is read by the payload object, and an error is generated if you try to set bits on the payload that exceed the size specified by byteSize.
expectedId - The expected CAN message ID. If this doesn't match the value of the ID in the payload object, then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown. This check tries to prevent you from registering the wrong payload object with a translator object. A value of 0 will cause the translator to skip the check.

CanPayloadTranslator

public CanPayloadTranslator(CanMailbox.ReadableCanMailbox payload,
                            int byteSize)
Constructor behaves in the same way as the WriteableCanMailbox methods. See those constructors for details.

addIntToBitset

public static void addIntToBitset(java.util.BitSet b,
                                  int value,
                                  int startLocation,
                                  int bitSize)
Utility method to add an integer value to a bit set. This method modifies the bits from startLocation to startLocation + bitSize by setting them according to the given integer value. By calling this method several times with different startLocations, multiple values can be stored in a single bitset.

Parameters:
b - BitSet to modify.
value - integer value to set. Negative values will be preserved
startLocation - the index in the bit set that corresponds to the least significant bit of the value. This value is zero-indexed.
bitSize - the number of bits used to represent the integer. Values larger than 32 will generate an error.

getIntFromBitset

public static int getIntFromBitset(java.util.BitSet b,
                                   int startLocation,
                                   int bitSize)
Recovers an integer value from the specified bit range. This method is designed to be used in conjunction with addIntToBitset.

Parameters:
b - The BitSet to read
startLocation - The location of the lsb of the value. This value is zero-indexed.
bitSize - The number of bits to read.
Returns:
The recovered (positive) integer value.

addUnsignedIntToBitset

public static void addUnsignedIntToBitset(java.util.BitSet b,
                                          int value,
                                          int startLocation,
                                          int bitSize)
Utility method to add an integer value to a bit set. This method modifies the bits from startLocation to startLocation + bitSize by setting them according to the given integer value. By calling this method several times with different startLocations, multiple values can be stored in a single bitset.

Parameters:
b - BitSet to modify.
value - integer value to set. negative values are not allowed
startLocation - the index in the bit set that corresponds to the least significant bit of the value. This value is zero-indexed.
bitSize - the number of bits used to represent the integer. Values larger than 32 will generate an error.

getUnsignedIntFromBitset

public static int getUnsignedIntFromBitset(java.util.BitSet b,
                                           int startLocation,
                                           int bitSize)
Recovers an integer value from the specified bit range. This method is designed to be used in conjunction with addIntToBitset.

Parameters:
b - The BitSet to read
startLocation - The location of the lsb of the value. This value is zero-indexed.
bitSize - The number of bits to read.
Returns:
The recovered (positive) integer value.

bitSetToBinary

public static java.lang.String bitSetToBinary(java.util.BitSet b,
                                              int minLength)
Returns a binary string representation of the BitSet. The low order bits will appear in the higher ("rightmost") indices of the returned string. The return value will be padded on the left with '0' characters to make it at least minLength characters long, if necessary.

Parameters:
b -
minLength - the minimum number of characters in the return value.
Returns:
